source_sentence: 佛為黃竹園老婆羅門說學經
translation: Foshuoyuan wives of the Yellow Bamboo Grove Buddha taught the studying scriptures to the Rāmaṇer
The lost name of the translator is now appended to the Song Dynasty Record

source_sentence: 聞如是：一時，婆伽婆在鞞蘭若黃竹園。
translation: Thus I have heard: One time, Bhagavān was staying at the yellow bamboo grove of Kaḷāraṇḍa.

source_sentence: 彼時，鞞蘭若婆羅門，年老耆宿命趣後世，生年百二十，手執杖，中食後行，
translation: At that time, a brāhmaṇa of Trāyastriṃśa named Kauṇḍinya was an old man. He was one hundred and twenty years old when he was born in the world after death.
He wandered around and went to the Bhagavān.
When they arrived, they comforted each other with the Bhagavān's face.

source_sentence: 世尊面相慰勞已，柱杖世尊前立，鞞蘭若却住一面已，白世尊曰：「此瞿曇！
translation: After the Bhagavān had comforted them face-to-face, he stood up in front of the Bhagavān with his pillar and staff, and after Kālāmaṇiṣṭhila stood to one side, he said to the Bhagavān,

source_sentence: 我聞沙門瞿曇年幼、學亦初，謂有大沙門婆羅門，彼來到亦不隨時恭敬，
translation: I have heard that the renunciant Gotama is young and beginner in learning. He said, “There is a great renunciant brāhmaṇa who comes here but does not pay respect to him at all times.
Nor does he get up from his seat and ask for a seat.
This is Gautama!
I won't allow you to do so.
This is a Brāhmaṇa!

source_sentence: 我亦不見天及世間魔梵、沙門婆羅門、眾天及人，令如來恭敬從坐起而請者。
translation: I don't see gods, worldly Māras, Brahmās, ascetics, priests, gods, or humans, so that the Tathāgata respectfully rises from his seat and invites them.
This is a Brāhmaṇa!

source_sentence: 謂如來若恭敬從坐起者，彼人頭破為七分」「此沙門瞿曇！
translation: It means that if the Tathāgata respectfully rises from his seat and stands up, that person's head breaks into seven parts.
but lazy and conceited!
This is a Brāhmaṇa!

source_sentence: 有方便我可有慢，不如汝所說。
translation: With skillful means, I may have conceit, but it's not as good as what you say.
This is a Brāhmaṇa!

source_sentence: 有色之味、聲之味、香之味、細滑之味，是如來已盡、已知，斷除根本，
translation: The taste of form, the taste of sound, the taste of odor, and the taste of fineness and smoothness—these are the roots by which the Tathāgata has exhausted and known.
In the future, he'll be frightened and won't again give rise to the Dharma.
This is a Brāhmaṇa!

source_sentence: 有是方便，令我有慢，不如汝所說。」
translation: There's this method that makes me conceit, which isn't as good as what you say.
“The renunciant Gotama!
There's no fear.
This is a Brāhmaṇa!

source_sentence: 復有方便，令我無有恐怖，不如汝所說。
translation: There's another method that will cause me to have no fear, which isn't as good as what you say.
It means a Brāhmaṇa!

source_sentence: 諸有色恐怖、聲恐怖、香恐怖、味恐怖、細滑恐怖，彼，如來已盡、已知，
translation: The fear of form, the fear of sound, the fear of smell, the fear of taste, and the fear of fineness and smoothness—they have all been exhausted and known by the Tathāgata.

source_sentence: 斷除根本，當來恐怖不復生。
translation: By eliminating the root, future fear won't arise again.
This is a Brāhmaṇa!

source_sentence: 有是方便，令我無有恐怖，不如汝所說。」
translation: There's this method that will cause me to have no fear, which isn't as good as what you say.
This is the ascetic Gautama!
They won't enter the womb again.
This is a Brāhmaṇa!

source_sentence: 有方便令我不入胎，不如汝所說。
translation: There's a method that causes me not to enter the womb, which isn't as you say.
This is a Brāhmaṇa!

source_sentence: 諸有沙門婆羅門，當還於有、入於胎，我已盡、已知，斷除根本，當來恐怖不復生，
translation: “Some śramaṇas and brāhmaṇas will return to existence or enter the mother’s womb. I have exhausted and known it, annihilated its root cause, and in the future fearlessness will not arise again.
I say it doesn't enter the womb.
This is a Brāhmaṇa!

source_sentence: 如來、無所著、等正覺，不復還入有於胎，已盡、已知，斷除根本，當來恐怖不復生，
translation: The Tathāgata, free from attachment and fully awakened, will no longer return to the womb. Having exhausted it and known it, he has cut off its roots and will never again experience fear in the future.
I won't enter the womb.
This is a Brāhmaṇa!

source_sentence: 有是方便，令我不入胎，不如汝所說。
translation: There's this method that causes me not to enter the womb, which isn't as you say.
Furthermore, Brāhmaṇa!

source_sentence: 我者於世，皆有愚癡、樂於愚癡、為愚癡所纏裹，我初分別法，我於眾生最在前說。
translation: The self is that in the world all have delusion, delight in delusion, and are bound by delusion. When I first discriminate things, I am the first to explain them to sentient beings.
It's like that, Brāhmaṇa!

source_sentence: 有鷄，產或十或二十卵，以時隨時在上伏，以時隨時伏，以時隨時轉側。
translation: There are chickens that lay sometimes ten or twenty eggs, which are subdued at any time and place when the season is right. They are subdued at any time and place when the season is right, and they turn their sides at any time and place

source_sentence: 謂彼鷄有所行，彼在卵中，以[口*(隹\/乃)]以足破卵已，安隱自出，
translation: That is to say, when that fowl does something, it's in the egg. After [mouthing*(hen\/now)] with its feet, it breaks open the egg and emerges safely on its own.
This is their first practice.
So it is, Brāhmaṇa!

source_sentence: 為愚癡所纏裹、以愚癡為陰覆。
translation: They're bound by foolishness and covered by the aggregate of foolishness.

source_sentence: 我初分別法，我於眾生最上說。
translation: The first self discriminates dharmas, and I'm the highest among sentient beings.
This is a Brāhmaṇa!

source_sentence: 手抱草至道場樹下，到已於道場樹下以草敷之，依敷尼師壇結加趺坐，
translation: He took the grass in his hand and went to the foot of a tree on the terrace of enlightenment. Having arrived there, he spread it out among the grass beneath the trees on the terrace of enlightenment. He sat cross-
They mustn't break their seat until they become completely contaminated.
This is a Brāhmaṇa!
I won't break down my seat until the end of the contaminants.
This is a Brāhmaṇa!

source_sentence: 於婬解脫，於諸惡不善法得解脫，自覺自行得愛喜，於初禪正受住。
translation: In the liberation from anger, they attain liberation from bad and unskillful qualities, self-realize on their own, attain craving and joy, and abide in the first dhyāna with right sensation.
This is a Brāhmaṇa!

source_sentence: 我於彼時得初思惟，見法安樂，住有樂行，不失安隱住乘於涅槃。
translation: At the time, I had first contemplated, saw the Dharma as peace and happiness, abided in pleasant practices, and didn't lose my peaceful abode and vehicle of nirvāṇa.
This is a Brāhmaṇa!

source_sentence: 息自覺自行，內有信樂，意應一心，無覺無行，得定歡喜，於二禪正受住。
translation: He stops self-awareness and self-reliance, has faith and joy within himself, is concentrated with one mind without perception or volition, attains concentration and rejoices, and abides in the second dhyāna with right feeling.
This is a Brāhmaṇa!

source_sentence: 於彼時得二思惟，見法安樂，住樂行，不失安隱住乘於涅槃。
translation: At that point, they attain two kinds of contemplation, see the Dharma as peaceful, abide in peaceful actions, and don't lose their peaceful abode and vehicle in nirvāṇa.
This is a Brāhmaṇa!

source_sentence: 愛喜無染，作於護，意念等知，身得安樂，謂聖所觀所護念安樂住，於三禪正受住。
translation: Delight and affection are undefiled. They act in order to protect [them]. The awarenesses of mind, etc., acquire peace and comfort with respect to their bodies. This means that the noble one observes what is guarded and abides
This is a Brāhmaṇa!

source_sentence: 我於彼時得三思惟，見法安樂，住樂行，不失安樂住乘於涅槃。
translation: At the time, I had three contemplations, saw the Dharma as peace and happiness, lived happily, practiced happily, and didn't lose my peaceful abode and vehicle in nirvāṇa.
This is a Brāhmaṇa!

source_sentence: 止樂止苦，棄前歡喜愛滅，無苦無樂護意清淨，於四禪正受住。
translation: He stops pleasure and stops suffering, abandons the former joy and love that ceases, has no pain or pleasure, is pure in guarding his mind, and abides in the fourth dhyāna with right feeling.
This is a Brāhmaṇa!

source_sentence: 我於彼時得四思惟，見法安樂，住樂行，不失安樂住乘於涅槃。
translation: At the time, I had four thoughts, saw the Dharma as peaceful, lived happily, practiced happily, and didn't lose the peaceful abiding vehicle of nirvāṇa.
This is a Brāhmaṇa!

source_sentence: 以此三昧意清淨白無有結，除諸結，柔濡行，常住不變異，念宿命智為證，
translation: With this concentration, his mind is pure and white with no fetters. Removing fetters, he practices gently and patiently, always abiding without change. He realizes it by means of the knowledge of past lives.
It's because he controls his own mind.
This is a Brāhmaṇa!

source_sentence: 有行有說，念無量宿所受，若一生二生百生千生，若一劫半劫無量諸劫，
彼彼眾生字是姓是，作性如是，食如是，苦樂如是，命長短，此間終生彼間，
translation: These sentient beings are thus conditioned by nature, eat thus, experience thus, suffer thus, enjoy thus, have a long life span, and are ultimately reborn here or there.

source_sentence: 彼間終生此間，在此間字是姓是，食如是食，命如是長短。
translation: At the end of his life, he'll be born here, and this word here is a family name. He eats such-and-such food, and his life is such-and-such long and short.
This is a Brāhmaṇa!

source_sentence: 我於彼時於夜半得初聖明，本無放逸行，今為定行，謂無智滅、智得生，
translation: At that time, at midnight, I had attained the first sacred illumination. In the past I practiced without heedlessness; now I practice with concentration. That is to say, I have no knowledge of cessation and no knowledge of arising.

source_sentence: 闇冥除、明得生，無明盡、明得成，謂念宿命明智為證。
translation: When darkness and ignorance are eradicated, insight arises; when ignorance is extinguished, insight is achieved: this means that the knowledge of recollection of former existences is their proof.
This is a Brāhmaṇa!

source_sentence: 以三昧意清淨白無有結，除諸結，柔濡行，常住無變異，得天眼智為證，
translation: Because the mind of concentration is pure and white with no fetters, he removes fetters, moves gently, always abiding without change, attaining the knowledge of divine vision as proof.
It's because he controls his own mind.
This is a Brāhmaṇa!

source_sentence: 我以天眼見清淨出過於人，眾生生者終者，有好有惡，有妙有醜，生善處惡處，
translation: With my divine eye, I see that the pure [dharma] surpasses humans. Sentient beings who are born at the end of life have good and bad qualities, which are marvelous and ugly, and are reborn in a good or bad

source_sentence: 隨眾生所作行，我知如真。
translation: Whatever sentient beings do, I know it as it really is.

source_sentence: 此眾生與身惡行俱、口惡行俱、意惡行俱，聖所不美，邪見與邪見俱，
translation: These sentient beings are accompanied by bad physical deeds, bad verbal deeds, and bad mental deeds. The holy ones do not praise them. False view is accompanied by false view.

source_sentence: 彼因彼緣，彼身壞死時生惡趣泥犁中。
translation: Because of those causes and conditions, they'll be born in a bad destiny in a mud plow when their body breaks up and dies.

source_sentence: 有眾生身與善俱、口善行、意善行，信有善行，等見與等行俱，彼因彼緣，
translation: “Some sentient beings are accompanied by wholesome bodily actions, wholesome verbal actions, and wholesome mental actions. They believe there is wholesome action. Equanimous views are accompanied by equanimous actions.

source_sentence: 彼身壞死時生善處天上。
translation: When their bodies disintegrate and die, they'll be born in a good place up in heaven.
This is a Brāhmaṇa!

source_sentence: 我於彼時，於夜過半得二明，本無放逸行，今得定行，謂棄無智、得於智，
translation: At that time, at midnight, I attained the two kinds of supernormal knowledge. In the past I practiced without laziness but now I am engaged in meditative absorption, which is to say that I have abandoned ignorance and att

source_sentence: 闇得除、明得成，無明盡、得有明，謂得天眼明智為證。
translation: When darkness is acquired, it is to be abandoned; when light is acquired, it is to be accomplished; when ignorance is extinguished, it is to have insight: the acquisition of the knowledge of the divine eye as witness.
This is a Brāhmaṇa!

source_sentence: 我以此三昧意清淨白無有結，除諸結，柔濡行，常住無變異，有漏盡智為證明，
translation: With this concentration, my mind is pure and white with no fetters. Removing fetters, I practice gently and patiently, always abiding without change. This knowledge of extinction of the defilements serves as proof.
It's because he controls his own mind.
This is a Brāhmaṇa!

source_sentence: 有此苦，知如真，苦習、苦盡、苦盡住處，知如真，此有漏、有漏習、有漏盡、有漏盡住處，
translation: He knows as it really is the accumulation of suffering, the extinction of suffering, and the abiding in cessation of suffering; he knows as it really is the abode of contamination, the accumulation of contamination, the exhaustion of contamination,

source_sentence: 知如真，彼知彼見漏有漏意解脫，有有漏、癡有漏意解脫，解脫已得解脫知，
translation: Knowing it as it really is, they know the liberation of contaminated thoughts that are viewed as tainted and impure. They have knowledge of the liberation of contaminated thoughts that are tainted with attachment and those of delusion that are tain

source_sentence: 生以盡、梵行以成、所作以辦、名色已有，知如真。
translation: He knows it as it really is because birth has ended, religious practice has been accomplished, deeds have been done, and names and forms already exist.
This is a Brāhmaṇa!

source_sentence: 我於彼時夜欲曉得於三明，本無放逸行，今得定行，無智盡、得有智，
translation: At that time, at dawn, I wished to acquire the three kinds of supernormal knowledge. In the past I practiced without laziness but now I am engaged in meditative absorption.

source_sentence: 無明盡、得有明，謂有漏盡智為證得明。
translation: The knowledge of the destruction of ignorance and the acquisition of insight are the realization of knowledge by the knowledge of the destruction of impure influences.
This is a Brāhmaṇa!

source_sentence: 謂有等說而說無愚癡，人生世間於眾生尠得離苦樂。
translation: It means that there's an equal explanation that says there's no folly, and the world of birth is free of suffering and happiness for sentient beings.
This is a Brāhmaṇa!
Some say 'we' and explain it.'
Why is it so?
This is a Brāhmaṇa!

source_sentence: 我非愚癡人出於世，於此世間最為妙，無有苦樂。」
translation: I'm not a foolish person who emerges from the world, and this world is the most marvelous in the world, with no pain or pleasure.

source_sentence: 於是鞞蘭若婆羅門放杖著地，頭面禮世尊足，在世尊前讚世尊：「世尊為最！
translation: Then the Brahman of Kaḷāraṇḍa released his staff and touched the ground, bowed his head and feet at the Bhagavān's feet, and praised him in front of the Bhagavān, Bhagavān!
Bhagavān, marvelous!
Bhagavān, it's most wonderful!

source_sentence: 世尊無與等，無有與世尊等者！
translation: The Bhagavān has no equal, and there's no equal to the Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 世尊無有患，世尊於人亦無恚。
translation: The Bhagavān has no trouble, and the Bhagavān has no anger toward people.
Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 我今自歸法及比丘僧，惟世尊！
translation: World-Honored One, I now take refuge in the Dharma as well as in the bhikṣus and sangha.

source_sentence: 我今持優婆塞，從今日始盡命離於殺，今自歸。」
translation: Now, I'll hold the upāsaka Upāsaka, who will begin today to part with killing for the rest of my life and now return on my own.
The Buddha thus explains it.

source_sentence: 鞞蘭若婆羅門聞世尊所說，歡喜而樂。
translation: Having heard what the World-honored One said, the brāhmaṇas of Kaḷāraṇḍa were delighted and happy.

source_sentence: 佛為黃竹園老婆羅門說學經
translation: Foshuoyuan wives of the Yellow Bamboo Grove Buddha taught the studying scriptures to the Rāmaṇer
